result.execSummary:
The defendant Belinda A Amos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 1 day sentence credit applied to costs. ($50.00) Remaining balance converted to a civil judgment forthwith.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
10:06 AM Defendant Belinda A Amos in court by zoom, in custody from Dane County.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Belinda A Amos.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Defendant requests to appear by video conferencing at the sentencing hearing.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court orders the following:	
1 Day credit
Costs:  $243.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
1 day credit to be applied $393.00 total left to pay on fine/surcharge.
Court to enter a civil judgment
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
